statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: John Carroll scored 24 points, Hassan Attia added a career-high 20 and Hartford beat UMass Lowell 84-73 on Wednesday night for its sixth win in eight games.
article.headline: Carroll scores 24 points, Hartford beats UMass Lowell 84-73
article.linkText: Carroll scores 24 points, Hartford beats UMass Lowell 84-73
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. -- John Carroll scored 24 points, Hassan Attia added a career-high 20 and Hartford beat UMass Lowell 84-73 on Wednesday night for its sixth win in eight games. J.R. Lynch had 19 points and a career-high nine assists, and Jason Dunne scored 11 for the Hawks (9-8, 2-1 America East Conference), who shot 56.9 percent from the floor. The River Hawks went without a field goal for six minutes before closing to 65-64 on Jahad Thomas's layup and Obadiah Noel's 3, then led 67-66 on Josh Gantz's 3 with 7:31 left. The lead traded hands before Carroll's go-ahead 3-point play sparked a 9-1 run for an 81-73 Hawks lead. Carroll has scored in double figures in 11 straight games. Attia scored 10 of Hartford's final 14 first-half points and the Hawks led 41-38 at halftime after trailing until the final 4:04. Gantz scored a career-high 19 points, Thomas added 16 points with eight assists, and Rinardo Perry scored 13 for UMass Lowell (6-9, 0-2), which has lost four straight.
